Fun Fact: This dynastine scarab beetle makes a weird huffing sound when itâ€™s disturbed.
Estimated Population Size: Unknown, but the beetle does not have special conservation status.
Distinctive Feature: Hard, armoured shell and horn-like pincers
Habitat: Rainforests of the mountains and lowlands
Location: South and Central America and the Lesser Antilles
Lifespan: Two and a half years, in total
Weight: 1.2 ounces for male, 0.57 ounces for female
Length: Average 2.43 inches for females, 3 inches for male plus horns longer than body. There have been rumors of a male that was 7.09 inches long.
Name: Hercules Beetle
